info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 6:47PM EDT until September 07 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Union County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 647 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wesley Chapel, or 6 miles west of Monroe, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Waxhaw, Lake Park, Mineral Springs, Hemby Bridge, Marvin, and Fairview In Union County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
